HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade integrates Wind River Linux with HP Helion OpenStack(R) to enable carrier grade network functions virtualization (NFV) capabilities.

HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade is based on HP Helion Openstack 1.1 but with significantly enhanced and optimized functionality, availability, scale and performance to meet the needs of NFV cloud deployments.

HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade uses multi-core HP Proliant rack-mounted servers with storage and networking along with the Wind River Titanium Server, HP Distributed Cloud Networking, Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM), and virtual switch software for reliable and accelerated data plane.
HP will contribute enhancements and optimizations made to HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade for NFV to upstream Openstack.
HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade is sold, and supported as a separate software entity from HP Helion Openstack.

section.title: Focus areas for HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade

ul.li: Central control plane but resources are distributed across geography interconnected by WAN
VNF resource requirement definition, policy based resource scheduling & placement
Integrated Physical and Virtual resource monitoring and self-healing
Integration with Opensource SDN controllers and service chaining

section.title: Major Components in HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade
section.p: Hp Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade incorporates a number of proven technologies into a single environment.

section.title: Helion Lifecycle Management (HLM)
section.p: Helion Lifecycle Management (HLM) is an application that is used to deploy HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade and can be used for ongoing operations and maintenance of the system.
For more information, see Helion Lifecycle Management (HLM) Overview.

section.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R)
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack(R) is a commercial-grade distribution of OpenStack(R) the leading open source cloud computing platform. This distribution, backed by HP, enables customers to more easily build, manage, and use open-source based hybrid cloud.
For more information, see HP Helion OpenStack(R) Overview.
Note: The servers that comprise the HP Helion OpenStack(R) cloud are referred to as hLinux servers in the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade documentation.

section.title: Wind River Linux
section.p: Wind RiverÂ(R) Linux is a Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) software platform, providing ultra-reliability and exceptional performance efficiencies for telecommunications networks.
For more information, see Wind River Linux Overview.

section.title: Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN)
section.p: Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) is a Software-Defined Networking (SDN) solution that provides data center (DC) network virtualization and automatically establishes connectivity between compute resources upon their creation.
For more information, see Distributed Cloud Networking Overview.

HP Helion OpenStack(R) offers many services based on the different OpenStack(R) projects to provide the functionality you need. Visit the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Services Overview page for a complete list of services.
